input.rev_rec_notes: Subscriptions (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Premier Success) recognized ratably over term. Implementation services recognized over time by milestone (kickoff + go-live). Training recognized when delivered. ~15% bundle discount allocated across POBs using SSP/list price method. Mid-term expansion on 07/01/2026 adds 200 Service Cloud users co-termed.
input.use_case_description: Salesforce sells an enterprise multi-cloud agreement that includes Sales Cloud (Enterprise) and Service Cloud (Enterprise) user licenses, plus a fixed-scope implementation services package and instructor-led training for admins/agents. The subscription portion is modeled as two separate product rate plans: (1) Sales Cloud (Enterprise) with a recurring per-user charge at $175/user/month billed annually, and (2) Service Cloud (Enterprise) with a recurring per-user charge at $175/user/month billed annually; the initial order is for 2,000 Sales Cloud users and 1,200 Service Cloud users. As part of the enterprise bundle, the customer negotiates a single commercial discount that reduces total contract consideration by ~15% versus combined list pricing across the subscription and services components, so we expect allocation across multiple performance obligations using SSP/list prices. Add Premier Success Plan as an attached subscription add-on rate plan priced at 30% of net license fees (calculated from the discounted Sales+Service license amount) and billed on the same annual schedule. Implementation Services are sold as a separate services product rate plan with a one-time fixed fee list price of $150,000 (discounted in the deal to $135,000) invoiced 50% at kickoff and 50% at go-live/acceptance. Trailhead Academy training is sold as a separate product rate plan with one-time per-attendee charges at $3,000 per attendee per course; the customer prepurchases 60 seats (list $180,000) discounted to $153,000 and training is delivered in the first 90 days. Mid-term expansion: on 07/01/2026 the customer adds 200 additional Service Cloud users co-termed to the 12-month agreement with proration for the remaining term and billed on the next invoice. Revenue expectation (inferred): subscriptions (including Success Plan) recognized ratably over the term; implementation recognized over time as services are performed (or by milestone if that best reflects progress); training recognized when delivered.

hints: “recurring per-user charge … billed annually” → RECURRING (and billing_period=Year)
“fixed-scope implementation services package” and “instructor-led training… one-time … charges” → ONE-TIME
“single commercial discount … reduces total contract consideration by ~15%” → DISCOUNT
“Mid-term expansion… adds 200 additional Service Cloud users co-termed” → AMENDMENT + CONTRACT MOD
“with proration for the remaining term” → PRORATION
“expect allocation across multiple performance obligations using SSP/list prices” → ALLOCATION (and enterprise ‘bundle’)
“invoiced 50% at kickoff and 50% at go-live/acceptance” and “recognized… by milestone (kickoff + go-live)” → CUSTOM EVENT

charges.name: Sales Cloud Enterprise User License
charges.listPriceBase: 175 USD per user per month (expressed as 2,100 per user per year for annual billing)

charges.name: Service Cloud Enterprise User License
charges.listPriceBase: 175 USD per user per month (expressed as 2,100 per user per year for annual billing)

charges.name: Service Cloud Enterprise User License - Expansion (Added 07/01/2026)
charges.listPriceBase: Co-termed add: 175 USD per user per month (2,100 per user per year); prorated for remaining term

charges.name: Premier Success Plan (30% of Net License Fees)
charges.listPriceBase: 0.30 * (Sales+Service license fees). List calculated off list license value; sell calculated off discounted/net license value.

rate_plans.ratePlanName: Trailhead Academy - Instructor Led Training (Prepaid Seats)

assumptions: Subscription term is 12 months starting 2026-01-01, so subscription end date is modeled as 2026-12-31.
Currency assumed USD.
Annual billing is implemented by setting billingPeriod=Year and converting 175/user/month into 2,100/user/year for list pricing; Zuora proration is assumed for partial-year segments.

The ~15% negotiated bundle discount is represented in Billing by using sellPrice values (net) rather than creating a separate discount charge line; Revenue allocation uses listPrice as SSP per instruction.
License net price assumed to be 15% off list (2,100 -> 1,785 per user/year) because an explicit net license discount was not provided.
Premier Success Plan list is calculated as 30% of list license fees (0.30 * 6,720,000 = 2,016,000) and sell is calculated as 30% of assumed net license fees (0.30 * 5,712,000 = 1,713,600).
Implementation milestone dates assumed: kickoff on 2026-01-01 and go-live/acceptance on 2026-03-31 (within first 90 days).
Training delivery assumed to occur primarily by 2026-02-15 (within first 90 days) and completed by 2026-03-31; recognition is driven by delivery/consumption events in Revenue.
Mid-term expansion on 2026-07-01 is modeled as a separate recurring charge segment (prospective add) co-termed to 2026-12-31 and billed on the next invoice run after 2026-07-01.
All charges are marked allocation-eligible because allocations are required and list price is the SSP basis.
open_questions: What is the actual Contract Effective Date (can differ from service start)?
What are the exact kickoff date and go-live/acceptance date for implementation (used for invoicing and event-based recognition)?
Will training be delivered in multiple sessions/dates (requiring multiple delivery events), and what are those dates?
Is auto-renew intended for this agreement, and if yes, should renewal be at 12 months with the same products/prices?

charge_pob_map.rationale: SaaS user license is a stand-ready service; recognize ratably over the contracted term with booking-based release.

alternatives.why_not: Billing-based release is not preferred here because the rev policy states ratable over term and billing is in advance; booking-based aligns better for term-based SaaS.

charge_pob_map.rationale: SaaS license recognized ratably over the term; booking-based release fits in-advance annual invoicing.

alternatives.why_not: Would shift release to billing events rather than booking; not aligned to stated approach.

charge_pob_map.chargeName: Service Cloud Enterprise User License - Expansion (Added 07/01/2026)
charge_pob_map.rationale: Co-termed add-on licenses are a distinct contract modification line; recognize ratably over the remaining term from the expansion effective date.

alternatives.why_not: If invoicing timing is delayed beyond 07/01/2026, billing-based could be considered; stated expectation is ratable over the remaining service window.

charge_pob_map.chargeName: Premier Success Plan (30% of Net License Fees)
charge_pob_map.rationale: Success Plan is a support/stand-ready service delivered continuously; recognize ratably over the term with booking-based release.

alternatives.why_not: Only needed if your rev design requires a PM-specific template; not required by the stated policy.

charge_pob_map.rationale: Milestone-based recognition: kickoff portion recognized at start/kickoff (treated as a point-in-time milestone).

alternatives.why_not: Use only if implementation is recognized over time (e.g., percent-complete) rather than milestone-based.

charge_pob_map.rationale: Second milestone recognized upon go-live/acceptance event; event-based release matches the stated policy.

alternatives.why_not: This would ratably recognize from go-live forward, which does not match milestone recognition for the go-live portion.

charge_pob_map.ratePlanName: Trailhead Academy - Instructor Led Training (Prepaid Seats)
charge_pob_map.rationale: Instructor-led training is recognized when delivered; map to a delivery/consumption event to recognize upon delivery dates.

alternatives.why_not: Would recognize at start date regardless of delivery, which conflicts with the stated 'recognized when delivered' policy.

mapping_notes: Allocation setup (List Price SSP): ensure ZR is configured to allocate transaction price across all POBs using the listPrice as SSP and sellPrice as transaction price.

Commercial discount: because the deal discount is represented via sellPrice per charge (not a separate discount line), the allocation will naturally allocate the total discount across POBs based on relative SSP (list).

Implementation milestones: modeled as two separate POB lines (kickoff + acceptance) to match the stated milestone-based recognition; if your policy is actually over-time (progress-based), remap to BK-OT-RATABLE or use POC-based events.

Training: mapped to EVT-PIT-CONSUMP-DELIVERY to ensure recognition happens upon delivery events rather than invoice/booking date; confirm your operational process can provide the delivery events to ZR.

zb_billings.Charge Name: Premier Success Plan (30% of Net License Fees)

zb_billings.Rate Plan: Trailhead Academy - Instructor Led Training (Prepaid Seats)

zb_billings.Charge Name: Service Cloud Enterprise User License - Expansion (Added 07/01/2026)
Premier Success Plan (30% of Net License Fees) - Expansion Proration

assumptions: License pricing: applied an overall ~15% commercial discount to license list price ($175/user/month), resulting in a net price of $148.75/user/month for both Sales Cloud and Service Cloud recurring charges.
Annual billing in advance: billed on 2026-01-01 for the period 2026-01-01 through 2026-12-31 (12-month termed subscription).

Premier Success Plan: billed as a flat fee equal to 30% of *net* (discounted) license fees for the billed period; also increases with the mid-term license expansion and is billed prorated for the remaining term.
Mid-term expansion: 200 Service Cloud users added on 2026-07-01, co-termed to 2026-12-31, prorated for 6 months (2026-07-01 through 2026-12-31) and billed on 2026-07-01 as the 'next invoice'.
Implementation Services: used the provided discounted total ($135,000) and split 50/50 into two one-time milestone billings ($67,500 each).
Acceptance / Go-Live milestone date: treated as 2026-01-01 based on the provided Go-Live Date (so both implementation milestones invoice on 2026-01-01).
Training: used the provided discounted total ($153,000) for 60 prepaid seats, implying a net unit price of $2,550 per seat; billed on 2026-01-01 (ContractEffective).
One-time charges: set Billing Period Start and End equal to the billing date since they are not recurring-period based.
open_questions: What is the exact discount mechanism in Zuora for licenses (e.g., explicit discount charge, price overrides, or separate discount rate plan)? I assumed a simple 15% net price for license recurring charges.
What is the actual Acceptance (Go-Live/Acceptance) date for the second implementation milestone? If it occurs after 2026-01-01, that billing row’s Billing Date should move accordingly.
For the 07/01/2026 expansion, should the proration be exactly 6 months (Jul–Dec) or based on exact day-count (e.g., 184/366 days in 2026)? I assumed a clean 6/12 proration.

Should the expansion be invoiced immediately on 2026-07-01, or only on the next scheduled annual invoice date (e.g., 2027-01-01) per your operational billing practice? I assumed immediate invoicing on 2026-07-01.

Is Premier Success Plan intended to be strictly 30% of net license fees within the same invoice period (so it always scales with expansions mid-term)? I assumed yes and billed a prorated delta on 2026-07-01.

Implementation Services - Fixed Scope Package / Implementation Services - Kickoff Milestone (50%)
Implementation Services - Fixed Scope Package / Implementation Services - Go-Live/Acceptance Milestone (50%)

zr_contracts_orders.POB Name: Service Cloud Enterprise User License - Expansion (Added 07/01/2026)
zr_contracts_orders.RPC Segment: Service Cloud (Enterprise) - User Licenses / Service Cloud Enterprise User License - Expansion (Added 07/01/2026)

assumptions: Overall enterprise commercial discount interpreted as 15% off the combined LIST amount of (Sales+Service licenses + Implementation list + Training list), excluding the Premier Success Plan which is priced via a formula; this implies net license factor = 0.8488839285714286 (15.111607% discount) applied uniformly to Sales Cloud and Service Cloud licenses.

Premier Success Plan SSP/List assumed to equal 30% of LIST license fees for the term (0.30 × (Sales+Service list)); Premier Success Plan Sell assumed to equal 30% of NET license fees (0.30 × (Sales+Service net)).

Allocation performed at the initial booking (Subscription Version 1) across all lines using relative SSP where SSP = List Price (per your Allocation Method = Use List Price). This results in line-level Ext Allocated Price differing from line-level Ext Sell Price.
Implementation milestone POBs treated as immediate recognition on the stated event dates (start=end) based on the provided POB templates (BK-PIT-STARTDATE and EVT-PIT-ACCEPTAN).
Training POB treated as immediate recognition at a single delivery/consumption date (2026-02-15) based on EVT-PIT-CONSUMP-DELIVERY, although the narrative says “delivered in the first 90 days”.
Mid-term expansion (effective 2026-07-01) treated as a prospective contract modification (Subscription Version 2) with standalone allocation (only one line, so allocated = sell).
Expansion proration assumed to be exactly 6/12 of the annual price for 2026-07-01 through 2026-12-31 (no day-count convention applied).
All lines flagged Allocation Eligible (no ramp/VC/carve rules provided).
Unreleased Revenue initialized to Ext Allocated Price and Released Revenue initialized to 0 per your instruction, regardless of immediate vs ratable POB behavior.
open_questions: Should the Premier Success Plan also be amended on 2026-07-01 to reflect 30% of the incremental net license fees for the added 200 Service Cloud users (prorated for the remaining term)? If yes, we need an additional Success Plan expansion line/POB.

For Implementation Services, do you want revenue recognized strictly by milestones (as modeled by the provided POB templates), or over time using a progress measure? If over time, we need the services POB template(s), start/end dates, and progress method.

Confirm the exact discounting approach intended: (a) single discount rate applied to all non-formula components, or (b) the explicitly stated discounts only (Implementation 10%, Training 15%) with a different discount rate for licenses; the current table assumes a blended approach to achieve ~15% overall discount on the non-success-plan components.
Confirm the proration convention for the 2026-07-01 expansion (daily proration vs month-based) and the exact billed-through end date (2026-12-31 vs 2026-06-30/2027-06-30 style co-terming).
Confirm whether any lines should be excluded from allocation eligibility (e.g., certain service milestones) per your ZR allocation setup/configuration.

assumptions: Revenue start/end dates are treated as inclusive for daily straight-line recognition (2026 is a non-leap year with 365 days).

For BK-OT-RATABLE POBs, revenue is recognized using a daily rate (Allocated Price / Total Days) multiplied by the number of service days in each calendar month; amounts are rounded to 2 decimals and the final month is trued-up for rounding.
Line 5 Acceptance milestone is assumed to occur on 2026-03-31 (per Contracts/Orders table), so 100% is recognized in Mar-26.

For the Trailhead Academy Training Seat (EVT-PIT-CONSUMP-DELIVERY), no delivery/consumption events were provided; the waterfall shows $0 recognized for Feb-26 through Dec-26 and assumes the remaining balance stays deferred. 'Ongoing' is modeled through 2026-12-31 as the reporting horizon.
open_questions: Trailhead Academy Training Seat (Line 6): Please provide the delivery/consumption event schedule (by date or by month) including units delivered and the unit rate (or enough data to derive the unit rate) so revenue can be released.
For Line 6, does the consumption/delivery window extend beyond 2026-12-31 (i.e., do seats expire after 12 months or remain available longer)?
Are there any contract modifications (price/term changes, partial terminations, or additional expansions) after 2026-07-01 that should be reflected in the waterfall?

assumptions: Commercial construct & scope: One enterprise agreement bundles (a) Sales Cloud Enterprise user subscriptions, (b) Service Cloud Enterprise user subscriptions, (c) fixed-scope Implementation Services, and (d) Trailhead Academy instructor-led training seats; Premier Success Plan is an attached subscription add-on priced as a formula based on license fees.
Contract term & currency: Initial subscription term is assumed to be 12 months from 2026-01-01 through 2026-12-31, in USD.

Billing cadence (subscriptions): License subscriptions and Premier Success Plan are billed annually in advance for the term starting 2026-01-01; the mid-term expansion is invoiced on/near its effective date (assumed 2026-07-01) as the 'next invoice'.

Product/rate plan modeling: Sales Cloud and Service Cloud are modeled as separate recurring per-user charges; Implementation and Training are modeled as separate one-time service/product rate plans; Premier Success Plan is modeled as a separate add-on subscription charge.
List price (SSP) basis: Revenue allocation SSP is assumed to be the listPrice on each line (allocation method = use list price), and all relevant lines are marked allocation-eligible.

Discount representation (billing): The negotiated bundle discount is represented via per-charge sellPrice overrides (no separate discount rate plan/discount charge line is created), while listPrice is retained for SSP-based allocation.

Discount math assumption for licenses: Because an explicit net license unit price was not provided, license net pricing is assumed to reflect an ~15% overall commercial discount vs combined list across non-Success-Plan components; a uniform net factor is applied to Sales Cloud and Service Cloud licenses (resulting in ~$148.75/user/month, i.e., $1,785/user/year).

Annual price conversion & proration: Annual billing is implemented by setting billingPeriod=Year and converting $175/user/month to $2,100/user/year list; proration for partial terms is assumed to be supported by Zuora for co-termed segments.

Premier Success Plan pricing: Premier Success Plan sell price is assumed to be 30% of net (discounted) license fees for the billed period; its SSP/list is assumed to be 30% of list license fees for the term.
Initial quantities: Initial order quantities are assumed to be 2,000 Sales Cloud users and 1,200 Service Cloud users for the full 12-month term.

Mid-term expansion modeling: On 2026-07-01, 200 additional Service Cloud users are added co-termed to 2026-12-31 as a prospective modification; expansion pricing is assumed prorated for the remaining term and allocated standalone for that modification.
Expansion proration convention: Expansion proration is assumed to be a clean 6/12 of the annual price for 2026-07-01 through 2026-12-31 (no day-count convention applied).
Implementation fee & invoicing: Implementation Services list is $150,000 and is discounted in the deal to $135,000; invoicing is assumed 50% at kickoff and 50% at go-live/acceptance.

Implementation milestone dates (working assumptions): Kickoff is assumed 2026-01-01; go-live/acceptance is inconsistently assumed across steps (either 2026-03-31 for rev rec/event recognition or 2026-01-01 for invoicing), implying the current billing vs revenue schedules may be misaligned until dates are confirmed.
Training pricing & billing: Training is modeled as 60 prepaid seats with list $180,000 discounted to $153,000 (net $2,550 per seat); billed at contract effective/start (assumed 2026-01-01).

Training delivery & recognition: Training is assumed delivered within the first 90 days; however, because no actual delivery/consumption events were provided, the revenue model assumes no releases occur (revenue remains deferred) within the current reporting horizon unless events are supplied.
Revenue recognition policy (subscriptions): Subscription licenses and Premier Success Plan are recognized ratably over the service term.

Revenue recognition policy (implementation): Implementation is assumed to be recognized either (a) by milestones (two POBs aligned to kickoff and acceptance) or (b) over time; the current modeling primarily assumes milestone-based recognition with event dates driving recognition.

Revenue recognition mechanics (ratable POBs): Ratable recognition uses daily straight-line with inclusive dates; monthly revenue is computed by service days per month, rounded to 2 decimals with final-month true-up (2026 treated as 365 days).

Allocation timing & journal initialization: Allocation is assumed performed at initial booking (subscription version 1), producing allocated revenue amounts that may differ from sell; unreleased revenue is initialized to allocated price and released revenue starts at 0 (per instruction).

Operational dependency: Event-based templates (implementation acceptance; training delivery/consumption) require operational processes to provide the required events to Zuora Revenue; absent events, revenue remains deferred.
open_questions: [BLOCKING] What is the authoritative Contract Effective Date and the service start date for each component (licenses, success plan, implementation, training)? (Affects invoicing start, revenue start, and allocation timing.)

[BLOCKING] What are the confirmed Implementation Services milestone dates (kickoff and go-live/acceptance), and should the second milestone be invoiced on the acceptance date (not 2026-01-01)? (Currently billing and rev-rec assumptions conflict.)

[BLOCKING] For Implementation Services, should revenue be recognized strictly by milestones or over time using a progress measure? If over time, provide POB template(s), service period dates, and progress methodology (e.g., cost-to-cost, labor hours).

[BLOCKING] Provide the Training delivery/consumption schedule (dates/sessions, seats delivered per date) and confirm whether seats expire; without events, Zuora Revenue cannot release training revenue appropriately.

[HIGH] Confirm the intended discounting approach across components: a single blended commercial discount applied uniformly to all non-formula components vs using only the explicitly stated discounts (Implementation 10%, Training 15%) with potentially different license discounting. (This drives sell prices, allocation, and reporting.)

[HIGH] Confirm the Premier Success Plan behavior for mid-term expansions: should it automatically adjust to 30% of incremental net license fees for added users and be prorated/invoiced at expansion (2026-07-01)? (Affects billing, modification modeling, and revenue.)

[HIGH] Confirm the proration convention for the 2026-07-01 expansion (exact day-count vs month-based) and the exact billed-through end date for the co-termed segment (e.g., through 2026-12-31). (Affects invoice amount and revenue schedules.)

[HIGH] Should the 2026-07-01 expansion be invoiced immediately on/after 2026-07-01 or only on the next scheduled annual invoice date per operational practice? (Affects cash, AR, and timing of billed amounts.)

[MEDIUM] How should the negotiated discount be implemented in Zuora Billing operationally: price overrides (sellPrice), an explicit discount charge, or a discount percentage plan? (Affects auditability, amendment behavior, and downstream integrations.)

[MEDIUM] Are any lines intended to be excluded from allocation eligibility under your Zuora Revenue configuration (e.g., certain services, training, or specific milestones)? (Affects allocation and revenue postings.)
[MEDIUM] Are renewals in scope (auto-renewal, renewal term length, and whether pricing/products carry forward)? (Affects forward-looking order setup and forecasting, not initial-year accounting.)
[LOW] Are there any additional contract modifications after 2026-07-01 (price changes, further expansions, partial terminations)? (Affects later-period billing and revenue waterfall accuracy.)
